sections.title: Ranger (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Ranger class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers are proficient with all simple and martial weapons, light and medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).

sections.title: Favored Enemy ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers gain bonuses to skills and combat against selected creature types, with additional favored enemies and increased bonuses at higher levels.

sections.title: Track ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers add half their level (minimum 1) to Survival skill checks made to follow tracks.

sections.title: Wild Empathy ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers can improve the attitude of animals using a Charisma-based check similar to Diplomacy, and can affect low-Intelligence magical beasts at a penalty.

sections.title: Combat Style Feat ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers select a combat style and gain bonus feats from that style without prerequisites, but lose benefits when wearing heavy armor.

sections.title: Endurance (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers automatically gain the Endurance feat as a bonus feat at 3rd level.

sections.title: Favored Terrain ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers gain bonuses to initiative and specific skills in selected terrain types, and leave no trail unless they choose to.

sections.title: Hunter’s Bond ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers choose between sharing favored enemy bonuses with allies as a move action or gaining an animal companion with shared bonuses.

sections.title: Spells (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers gain divine spellcasting starting at 4th level, preparing spells from the ranger spell list with Wisdom-based DCs.

sections.title: Woodland Stride ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers move through natural undergrowth at normal speed without damage, but magical terrain still affects them.

sections.title: Swift Tracker ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers can track at normal speed without penalty and take reduced penalties when tracking at double speed.

sections.title: Evasion ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers take no damage on successful Reflex saves against attacks that normally deal half damage, but only in light/medium armor or no armor.

sections.title: Quarry ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers designate a favored enemy as quarry, gaining tracking benefits, attack bonuses, and automatic critical confirmation against that target.

sections.title: Camouflage ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers can use Stealth to hide in favored terrains even without cover or concealment.

sections.title: Improved Evasion ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers take no damage on successful Reflex saves and only half damage on failed saves against area effects.

sections.title: Hide in Plain Sight ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers can use Stealth in favored terrains even while being observed.

sections.title: Improved Quarry ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers can select quarry as a free action, take 20 on tracking checks, gain increased attack bonuses, and select new quarry faster.

sections.title: Master Hunter ([Ex](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/special-abilities#TOC-Extraordinary-Abilities-Ex-)) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers track at full speed without penalty and can make instant-death attacks against favored enemies once per day per enemy type.

sections.title: Seen It Before (Ex) (Ranger)
sections.description: Rangers add their favored enemy bonus as an insight bonus on saves against spells and abilities used by those favored enemies.
